root: ^The man in the chair has his arms crossed in his lap. He's looking around, admiring the jars, the tubes, and the bottles, all instruments of your craft. His phone is set aside, and he left his shoes at the door. You like him already.

s: ^"It's a pleasure! What can I help you with?"

request: ^"Could you please do the Rebirth package? With cucumbers and KRX-19."

^You nod and turn towards the counter. You prefer to tailor each treatment, scrutinizing every little ingredient until it's just right for them. But Rebirth is reliable, a universal starter – the star of your marketing. It's a good choice.
^As your hands touch his face, he relaxes into the chair, lets out a small exhale. You note the bags under his eyes, his chapped lips, his colorless skin. It is a lot, but you can help.

s: ^Should I add our special gel for sleeping aid?

money: ^"No, no, thank you, I only want to try out the standard mask. I've heard it's really relaxing."
^You don't press further – and he's right, even your basic treatments can do wonders. But Mateo shifts in the chair, and, when you don't reply, he looks away.
^"To be honest, I was thinking I should visit for a while now. You've got stellar reviews. It's just, well, it is a bit expensive." He gives you an apologetic shrug.

s: ^You spread the primer gel over his forehead.

skip_1: ^"So then I find out the shi– uh, the place I work at reimburses self-care. It has a limit, but still, why shouldn't I have a day just to myself on company money." He catches your eyes again, looking for something.

s: ^"Trust me, it's worth it. I even do them for myself once in a while."
^"I know what you mean, it is a bit pricey. But it's such a delicate process, every little thing counts. Whenever I do masks for myself, I'm as excited as the first time."

commitment: ^You take off your gloves, fold them, and place them into the hazard bin. Then pick the new ones, then set out the mask itself, then gently smooth it out on the flat surface. You can't help but smile, admiring its elegant simplicity. Mateo watches you work, and the portrait of Sam Ray, your founder, looks down on you with pride.
^"You really do like your job, don't you?" There's no surprise in Mateo's voice, only a trace of envy. You understand, not everyone is lucky enough to have a job like yours.
tiny_pause: ^You return to the chair. The mask is so light in your hands.

s: ^"I get to help you. I get to make your day better."

bonding: ^"Yeah, I know what you mean. I miss that feeling sometimes."
nurse: ^"Oh, no, I worked at MGH as a nurse. Still do, I mean. And I know how it feels, that thing you're describing."
skip_2: ^You catch that longing in his voice, same one you had before you started at MASK. Mateo closes his eyes, the gel flows into all the imperfections, righting all the wrongs of the world.
^"Sure, some patients suck, but even the sucky ones got me out of bed in the morning". His voice is hopeful and a bit delirious. The medicine is helping.
confession: ^"No... Maybe? I guess it's just disappointment." Mateo looks at you, slowly. "Tell me. What would you do, if you learned MASK wasn't really helping people?"

s: ^"That's such a strange question to ask, sir."
^"I do not think it's possible. But, I suppose, it would be difficult for me."

thanks: ^"Thank you", he replies, "I'm glad you feel the same."
bye: ^When the mask comes off, Mateo feels like a new person. His smile is bright and earnest, and there's no sign of worry on his face. He says he'll come again.
